      void attackingKing(Piece king, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> attackingMoves)

      void kingCanMove(Piece king, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> attackingKing, java.util.ArrayList<Tile> canMove)
      Calculates the Tiles a given King can move to given the tiles currently attacking said King and writes the tiles to an ArrayList Calculation iterates through the avaliable diagonal and horizontal positions and performs a basic availability evaluation, but with 2 additional rules: The King cannot move to a square that is inCheck relative to its own type (Utilizes Board::inCheck) The King cannot move to a square adjacent to another King, adjacent King evaluations read from diagonal king check and horizontal king check offset multidimensional arrays to calculate the evaluation offsets to be used at each of the horizontal and diagonal offset arrays

      Normalizes a value direction within the context of Chess to be quantifiable into the basic system of Rows and Columns.

      • normalize

        public static final int normalize(int num)
        Normalizes a value direction within the context of Chess to be quantifiable into the basic system of Rows and Columns. If the number is equal to 0, the normalized value is 0. Otherwise it is the number divided by its absolute value, which would retain the sign, specifying the direction of movement.
        Parameters:
        num, - the number to be normalized
        Returns:
        the normalized value

      • withinBounds

        protected static final boolean withinBounds(int row,
                                            int col)
        Returns whether or not a row and column position is within the bounds of a chess Board
        Parameters:
        row, - the row for the position
        col, - the column for the position
        Returns:
        true or false

      • inCheck

        public boolean inCheck(Piece king,
                       int row,
                       int col)
        Calculates whether or not a certain position is in Check, in another sense, whether or not a given King WOULD BE in check if it were on that position. Calculation is performed by checking all of the possible attacking squares with a Diagonal shaped checking algorithm, a Horizontal one, and an L-shaped one. Each algorithm checks for specific attacking pieces. If an attacking piece is found the algorithm ends
        Parameters:
        king, - the king to check for and perform evaluations on
        row, - the row of the position
        col, - the column of the position
        Returns:
        whether or not the position is in Check

      • attackingKing

        public void attackingKing(Piece king,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Tile> attackingMoves)
        Calculates the tiles attacking a given King and writes the Tiles to an ArrayList Calculation is performed by checking all of the possible attacking squares with a Diagonal shaped checking algorithm, a Horizontal one, and an L-shaped one. Each algorithm checks for specific attacking pieces.
        Parameters:
        king, - the given King
        attackingMoves, - the list of tiles to be written to (cleared before writing)

      • kingCanMove

        public final void kingCanMove(Piece king,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Tile> attackingKing,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Tile> canMove)
        Calculates the Tiles a given King can move to given the tiles currently attacking said King and writes the tiles to an ArrayList Calculation iterates through the avaliable diagonal and horizontal positions and performs a basic availability evaluation, but with 2 additional rules: The King cannot move to a square that is inCheck relative to its own type (Utilizes Board::inCheck) The King cannot move to a square adjacent to another King, adjacent King evaluations read from diagonal king check and horizontal king check offset multidimensional arrays to calculate the evaluation offsets to be used at each of the horizontal and diagonal offset arrays
        Parameters:
        king, - the given King
        attackingKing, - the tiles attacking the King
        canMove, - the list of tiles to be written to (cleared before writing)

      • attackWhiteListed

        public void attackWhiteListed(java.util.ArrayList<Tile> attackingKing,
                              Piece king,
                              java.util.ArrayList<Tile> whiteListed)
        Calculates the WhiteListed tiles based on a given King and the tiles attacking it, and writes the WhiteListed tiles to an ArrayList WhiteListed tiles are defined as Tiles that would be able to defend the King from Check without moving the King itself. When the King is in Check other pieces may only make whiteListed moves Algorithm is terminated upon 4 conditions: The list of tiles attacking the King is empty and therefore there is no whiteList The list of tiles attacking the King is over 1 and therefore there are no WhiteListed defense positions The first attacking Piece is a Knight and therefore the only WhiteListed tile is the Knight position (a Knight cannot be blocked, only taken to prevent Check) Neither is true so the full algorithm is performed: Every tile from the attacked King location up until the first attacking Piece location is added to the WhiteList
        Parameters:
        attackingKing, - the tiles attacking the given King
        king, - the given King
        whiteListed, - the ArrayList to be written to, representing the WhiteList

      • initWhiteBoard

        public final void initWhiteBoard(byte[][] board,
                                 Game game)
        Initializes the Board object with the BoardGUI viewed from White perspective, and the Board ArrayLists used to store references to the Board pieces
        Parameters:
        board, - the board as ByteBoard, a 2D array of bytes representing the type of piece at each tile row/col position
        game, - the game each Piece belongs to (determines a Piece effect on Game flow and Game GUI)

      • initBlackBoard

        public final void initBlackBoard(byte[][] board,
                                 Game game)
        Initializes the Board object with the BoardGUI viewed from Black perspective, and the Board ArrayLists used to store references to the Board pieces
        Parameters:
        board, - the board as ByteBoard, a 2D array of bytes representing the type of piece at each tile row/col position
        game, - the game each Piece belongs to (determines a Piece effect on Game flow and Game GUI)
